description:
The Jamaican government implemented a social and economic support program called the CARE Programme, which provides assistance to vulnerable individuals and small businesses through innovative and existing delivery channel. More specifically, the program provides:
1. compassionate grants to those who were unemployed or informally employed pre-pandemic;
2. temporary unemployment benefits to the previously employed who have been laid off or terminated since the pandemic; and
3. grants to the self-employed whose regular earnings have been disrupted in addition to grants to small businesses.
type_text: The Jamaican government implemented a social and economic support program called the CARE Programme, which provides assistance to vulnerable individuals and small businesses through innovative and existing delivery channel. More specifically, the program provides: 1. compassionate grants to those who were unemployed or informally employed pre-pandemic; 2. temporary unemployment benefits to the previously employed who have been laid off or terminated since the pandemic; and 3. grants to the self-employed whose regular earnings have been disrupted in addition to grants to small businesses.
